Posts.Content: Nov 1, 2014 02:56PM yangtan wrote: I am on navelbine too and together with floroucil 5 which is in a small ball pump that I carried with me 24/7. After 4 cycles and by the grace of God, my 3cm node on my neck is eradicated. As of now there is no evidence of disease. But I still have to continue with this regime for another 4 more cycles. This is suppose to be easy but not so with me. I ran a mild fever everyday. My body ached. I lost my hair. I had ti have blood transfusion in both the third and fourth cycle. And my wbc fell to a critically low level in the 4th cycle. My oncologist will adjust the dosage going forward. Wishing you the best in the treatment.
Posts.Title: On to Navelbine. Any help or suggestions? MRSROCKYTOP55 MRSROCKYTOP55

Posts.Content: yangtan wrote: My one tiny lymph node has now spread to some lymph nodes making a giant tumor at the neck area. Any body with similar problem ? I have been in Chemotherapy for four years but recently I can’t seem to reduce the size of the tumor. Anybody has similar problem and how do you cope? My right arm has very limited mobility range. Will Idie from this ? Posts.Title: Navalibine information stellaratovsky yangtan

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2017 02:07AM yangtan wrote: my doctor doesn't use the common ca15.3. it's not accurate for me. I use the ca 19.9 that normally measures liver. Also my met is on the lymph node so the Doc can feel and measure with his calipers. So happy that he can't measure it any more. I am given booster shots for the red blood and white blood cells. Nothing for platelets. I have no choice butdrink lots of dates tea and eat papaya including the yaky seeds. Folklore has it that papaya leaves tea help but hey where to find that in a urban supermarket. I also realise that when I sleep well blood counts are generally better so I am taking sleeping pills. I am tired most of the time. No matter how I try I still do think about cancer and sleep often is difficult. Many non cancer and healthy people just don't get it. I have decided my time is too precious trying to explain and I just do what I need for me. Hey I have bigger problem than sleeping pill addiction.

Otherwise other than fatigue or laziness its actually not too bad

Posts.Content: Mar 25, 2017 12:32AM yangtan wrote: I have been fighting this for the last 2.5 years, my only site of met. I was given chemo, navelbine and 5 flu that put me in NED for a year. Quality of life was not great. Then it came back I was on haleven put me in NED only six months. Tried taxol, didn't work. Then I was on A/A worked nicely with very decent quality of life for a year. Unfortunately it came back just this week. Meeting my oncologist on Monday looking for new solution. Well, he assured me that I should be around for quite a long time. But I am anxious of my new treatment and quality of life

Posts.Title: GEMZAR WarriorG RosesToeses

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2017 10:32PM yangtan wrote: updates Just done done cycle 4b of gemzar and carboplatin After cycle 3 I took a week off to see whales in Western Australia. Finally I put on 2 kg with all the good food at wineries. Too bad could only sip a teeny weeny bit of wine cos liver function not great. It was a great week without thinking of cancer and dealing with any of the side effects. Back to chemo last Monday and yesterday. Basically the fatigue is really bad. I just want to stay put and not do anything. Blood counts bad. Constipation and insomnia too. But this combo seems to be working. Tumor marker is back in the black and tumor size felt barely there. What to do I just have to persevere. Thank God children are in their 20s. Right now I can't even pretend to keep house

Posts.Content: Jun 6, 2017 08:09PM yangtan wrote: I wanted to give gemzar a fair chance o for first cycle I took 3 doses before resting for a week. It was tough and I doubt I could sustain it in the Long run. My Doc suggest I am better off doing two weeks on one week rest hence forth. My side effects are blood is affected so booster shots for WBC and RBC, constipation, when I poo family rejoice and fatigue and insomnia. I take sleeping pills and or anti anxiety pills. Less importantly I think my hair is thinning. I am trying to get energy back. I am thankful that I can do nothing as my kids are all in 20s.
